titleStmt.title: William McCow v. Territory of Washington. Complaint

bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: The return of George F Thomas Sheriff of Walla Walla County Washington Territory to the writ of habeas corpus hereto annexed

In obedience to the writ of habeas corpus hereto annexed I do hereby certify and return to the Hon. S.C. Wingard Judge of the First Judicial District of Washington Territory that before the coming of said writ to me on the 31st day of January 1877 at Walla Walla Washington Territory the said William McCow mentioned in said writ was placed in my custody by virtue of a commitment issued out of Justice Court by O.P. Lacy one of the Justices of the Peace in and for Walla Walla County W.T. under the sentence of the said Court on a charge of the crime of assualt with the intent to kill and murder and ordered to be committed to the County Jail of Walla Walla County Washington Territory for his appearance at the May term 1877 of the District Court of the First Judicial District Wash. Ter. unlike he should give
bonds in the sum of one thousand dollars which bond he failed to give and the said William McCow is now in my custody by virtue of said commitment a copy of which is hereto annexed and which I certify and I have here his body before said Hon S.C. Wingard Judge as by the said writ I am commanded.
div1.ab: George F. Thomas Sheriff W.W Co
div1.p: J.B. Thompson Deputy Sheriff & Jailer of Walla Walla County being sworn deposes and says that the within return is true as he verily believes
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 31st January 1877
div1.ab: A. Reeves Aymes Clerk Dist. Court 1st Dist.
div1.p: Complaint & Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus of William McCow
div1.ab: A. Reeves Ayers Clerk District Court
